title: Grade 5 Scholarship Exam results released
byline: The results of the 2025 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination have been released online, the Commissioner General of Examinations announced.

title: At least 15 killed in crash on Lisbon”s historic cable car railway
byline: At least 15 people died and 18 were injured on Wednesday (Sep 3) when Lisbon”s Gloria funicular railway car derailed and crashed, an emergency medical service spokesperson told reporters.

title: CID uncovers ICE production facility of ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’ in Nuwara Eliya
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department has uncovered that notorious organised criminal Mandinu Padmasiri alias Kehelbaddara Padme had been operating an illegal ice drug production facility in Nuwara Eliya.

title: PM Harini emphasised the importance of child-focused public financing
byline: Prime Minister Dr Harini Amarasuriya has emphasised the critical importance of child-focused public financing, noting that “Government budgets are among the most powerful instruments for realizing the rights and well-being of children as enshrined in the Convention on the Rights of the Child."

title: Israel rejects Hamas’ ceasefire offer, vows to press on with Gaza City offensive
byline: Israel on Wednesday rejected Hamas’ proposal for reaching a comprehensive ceasefire deal in Gaza to end the war, saying its army will continue to prepare for a major attack on Gaza City.

title: Grade 5 Scholarship Exam cut-off marks released
byline: The district-level cut-off marks of the Grade 5 Scholarship Examination 2025 have been released by the Department of Examination.

title: Court issues order preventing arrest of attorney appeared for Thusitha Halloluwa
byline: The Court of Appeal has issued an interim restraining order preventing the Colombo Crimes Division from arresting an attorney-at-law in connection with the ongoing investigation into the shooting incident involving former Director of the National Lotteries Board, Thusitha Halloluwa.

title: CEB workers to launch ‘work-to-rule’ trade union today
byline: All trade unions of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) have decided to launch a work-to-rule trade union action today (04).

title: Showers, strong winds expected in various parts of the country today
byline: A few showers may occur in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in the Galle, Matara, Kandy, and Nuwara-Eliya districts today (04), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: US economy on brink of recession, warns Moody’s chief economist
byline: The state-level data in the US shows that the country is “on the edge of recession”, said Mark Zandi, chief economist at credit rating agency Moody’s.

title: 200 children with cancer die annually in Sri Lanka: NCCP
byline: Approximately 200 children with cancer die annually in Sri Lanka, according to Dr. Suraj Perera, a Consultant Community Physician attached to the National Cancer Control Programme (NCCP).

title: Grade 5 scholarship exam: Top performers revealed
byline: According to the results of the 2025 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination, the highest-scoring student in the Sinhala medium is from the Galle District, the Commissioner General of Examinations, A.K.S. Indika Kumari stated.

title: At least 15 killed in crash on Lisbon’s historic cable car railway
byline: At least 15 people died and 18 were injured on Wednesday (Sep 3) when Lisbon’s Gloria funicular railway car derailed and crashed, an emergency medical service spokesperson told reporters.

title: Wild elephant injured in train collision in Habarana
byline: A wild elephant was hit by the night mail train traveling from Trincomalee to Colombo last night (03) in Puwakpitiya, Habarana.

title: Shanudi Amaya of Ambalangoda Sri Devananda secures highest marks in scholarship exam
byline: According to the results of the 2025 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination, Shanudi Amaya Ashwini, a student of the Sri Devananda College of Ambalangoda, has secured first place in the island.

title: No approval for road construction through Sinharaja Forest – Environment Minister
byline: No approval will be granted for any road construction within the Sinharaja Forest Reserve, Minister of Environment Dr. Dammika Patabendi.

title: France hits Google with $381 million fine for consumer protection failures
byline: France’s data protection authority said on Wednesday it had fined Alphabet’s, opens new tab Google 325 million euros ($381 million) for improperly displaying ads to Gmail users and using cookies, both without Google account users’ consent.

title: UAE warns Israel that annexing West Bank would cross ‘red line’
byline: The United Arab Emirates has warned Israel that annexing the occupied West Bank would cross a “red line” and undermine the spirit of the Abraham Accords that normalised relations between the two countries.

title: 44 complaints related to teenage pregnancies lodged in first seven of 2025
byline: The National Child Protection Authority states that 44 complaints related to teenage pregnancies have been received during the first seven months of this year.

title: Cabinet approves proposal to close 33 SOEs under two stages
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal for the liquidation and closure of 33 state-owned enterprises under two stages.

title: GMOA strike at Ratnapura Teaching Hospital called off
byline: The strike launched by doctors at the Ratnapura Teaching Hospital, which lasted for three days, has been called off as of noon today (04).

title: Court dismisses Midigama Ruwan’s petition to remove STF from Boossa Prison
byline: The Court of Appeal has dismissed a petition filed by J.A. Ruwan Kumara alias Midigama Ruwan, a notorious underworld leader, through his attorney, seeking an order to remove the officers of the Police Special Task Force (STF) from activities such as internal inspections of the Boossa High-Security Prison.

title: Jeep modified to resemble an official Police vehicle seized in Kandy
byline: A jeep, modified to resemble an official vehicle used by senior police officers, has been taken into custody by the Kandy Headquarters Police.

title: Cabinet approves new circular for state school admissions
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal to issue a new circular regarding the admission of students from Grade 2 to Grade 11, excluding Grades 5 and 6, in government schools.

title: Female doctor arrested in Kandy for driving luxury vehicle with fake number plates
byline: A female doctor has been arrested by the Crimes Investigation Division of the Kandy Police on suspicion of driving a luxury vehicle with forged number plates.

title: 2 dead, 12 injured as bus topples down precipice on Ella-Weelawaya road
byline: (UPDATED) At least two persons are reported dead while another 12 individuals have been injured and hospitalised after a bus toppled down a precipice near the 24th Km Post on the Ella-Weelawaya main road.
